text: Douglas Anderson Supernaw (September 26, 1960 - November 13, 2020) was an American country music singer-songwriter and guitarist. He signed with BNA Records in 1993. Supernaw was born in Bryan, Texas. Supernaw released four studio albums: Red and Rio Grande (1993), Deep Thoughts from a Shallow Mind (1994), You Still Got Me (1995), and Fadin' Renegade (1999), as well as two compilation albums, 1997's The Encore Collection, and 2017's "Greatest Hits". Between 1993 and 1996, he charted eleven singles on the Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now Hot Country Songs) charts, including "I Don't Call Him Daddy", a Number One single in late 1993. Supernaw announced on February 4, 2019 that he had been diagnosed with stage IV lung and bladder cancer. He died from the diseases on November 13, 2020 in Livingston, Texas at the age of 60. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website Category:1960 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from bladder cancer Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:American country singers Category:American country guitarists Category:Singer-songwriters from Texas Category:Musicians from Texas Category:BNA Records artists
title: Doug Supernaw
